personal_information.name: Akshat Chauhan
personal_information.title: AI Engineer, Systems, Cryptography, and Full-Stack Development

professional_summary.description: I'm a full-stack and systems developer with a deep interest in how software, networks, and infrastructure interact. My work bridges web development, system design, and network engineering, with a particular focus on cryptography and building secure, resilient systems.
professional_summary.philosophy: Technology should empower individuals, automate the mundane, and unlock new possibilities through intelligence and decentralization.
professional_summary.value_proposition: Building intelligent, secure, and scalable systems at the intersection of full-stack development & systems engineering.

experience.description: Contributing to applied AI research in computer vision and NLP. Mentoring junior researchers and delivering seminars to enhance lab collaboration and technical literacy.

projects.name: YT Video Summarizer
details: Developed a CNN-LSTM model for lip reading from silent video frames using the GRID corpus dataset.
Achieved ~96% word-level accuracy with OpenCV-SciSec facial landmark detection and TensorFlow sequence modeling.
Deployed real-time demo via Flask backend with GPU acceleration, optimized for Jetson Nano.

projects.name: Deep Research Agent
details: Engineered an image-to-LaTeX translator using CNN + Seq2Seq Attention achieving 92% symbol accuracy.
Applied TensorRT for GPU inference acceleration, reducing latency by ~35%.
Optimized model for low-compute edge devices.

experience.description: Contributing to applied AI research in computer vision and NLP. Mentoring junior researchers and delivering seminars to enhance lab collaboration and technical literacy.

projects.name: LipRead
details: Developed a CNN-LSTM model for lip reading from silent video frames using the GRID corpus dataset.
Achieved ~96% word-level accuracy with OpenCV-SciSec landmark detection + TensorFlow sequence modeling.
Deployed real-time demo via Flask backend with GPU acceleration, optimized for Jetson Nano.

projects.name: News Classifier
details: Built a BERT-based multi-label news classifier for 10+ categories using 100k+ scraped articles.
Enhanced precision by ~15% via active learning and data augmentation.
Integrated LIME explainability and built a Flask + React dashboard for live analytics.

projects.name: Handwritten Equation Solver
details: Built an image-to-LaTeX translator using CNN + Seq2Seq Attention with 92% accuracy.
Applied TensorRT for GPU acceleration, reducing latency by ~35%.
Optimized inference for low-compute edge devices.

experience.description: Overhauled the organization's website to enhance performance, accessibility, and visual appeal. Organized events, conducted hackathons, and served as a panel judge while leading engineering across the community.

projects.name: Chronos v2.0
details: Designed and deployed a full-stack hackathon platform (React + Node.js + MongoDB).
Handled 250+ registrations and 500+ project submissions.
Added automated evaluation APIs + async queueing reducing processing time by ~40%.
Co-organized the university-wide AI Hackathon and evaluated 20+ projects.

projects.name: AISOC Website
details: Led full redesign using Next.js + Tailwind, improving load times by ~55%.
Implemented CMS backend via Sanity.io for dynamic publishing.
Deployed on Vercel with Cloudflare caching + analytics integration.
Conducted workshops on web dev, Git workflows, and CI/CD.

featured_projects.title: EchoTrap: Self-Rebuilding TCP Honeypot
featured_projects.purpose: Built to study and defend against automated port scanning attacks in real-world network environments.
featured_projects.description: A Rust-based intelligent TCP honeypot that detects port scanning attacks and dynamically migrates its listening port in real time while logging detailed metrics.

featured_projects.title: QuantumLock: Post-Quantum Cryptographic Engine
featured_projects.purpose: Preparing for the quantum computing era by implementing quantum-resistant encryption algorithms.
featured_projects.description: A Rust-based post-quantum encryption engine designed to protect data using lattice-based and quantum-resistant cryptographic algorithms.

featured_projects.title: HuffSpace: File Compression Tool
featured_projects.purpose: Optimizing storage efficiency for large-scale data processing pipelines and archival systems.
featured_projects.description: A Rust-based tool that uses Huffman Coding to compress and decompress files efficiently with lossless recovery and real-time performance insights.

research_papers.title: EchoTrap: Cryptographic Hardening Study
research_papers.problem: TCP honeypots are highly vulnerable to timing-based fingerprinting and known-pattern exploits.
research_papers.solution: Implemented cryptographic event logging and timing-obfuscation layers using Rust's async runtime.
findings: Successfully captured adversarial patterns across 2M+ logged events
Provided secure log-integrity using incremental hashing
research_papers.impact: Enables safer honeypot deployments and deeper adversarial intelligence collection.

research_papers.title: BLAKE3 vs SHA-256 Performance Analysis
research_papers.problem: Hash function performance varies dramatically across CPU architectures, creating unpredictable latency in distributed systems.
research_papers.solution: Developed a Rust-based benchmarking suite testing multithreading, memory usage, and warm-up behaviors.
findings: BLAKE3 achieved ~1200 MB/s throughput on 8-core systems
SHA-256 degraded up to 40% under thread contention
SHA-3 demonstrated stable memory usage but slow initial warm-up
research_papers.impact: Helps engineers choose optimal hashing algorithms for backend pipelines and distributed storage systems.

research_papers.title: Zero-Knowledge Proof Implementation
research_papers.problem: Most zk-SNARK examples lack practical constraints or real-world performance considerations.
research_papers.solution: Implemented zk-SNARKs from scratch in Rust with a focus on prover efficiency and constraint system optimization.
findings: Prover performance improved 32% with multi-threaded batching
Constraint reduction reduced proving time by 18%
Achieved stable verification under low-power devices
research_papers.impact: Enables more practical privacy-preserving authentication systems and off-chain proof computation.

research_papers.title: Distributed Key Exchange Protocol
research_papers.problem: Traditional key exchange mechanisms struggle in distributed, peer-to-peer environments with untrusted nodes.
research_papers.solution: Designed a hybrid cryptographic protocol combining classical + PQ primitives with secure multi-party coordination.
findings: Achieved stable key agreement across unreliable networks
Hybrid encryption reduced compromise probability significantly
Provided forward secrecy while maintaining lightweight performance
research_papers.impact: Useful for secure P2P messaging systems, decentralized networks, and distributed consensus protocols.

research_papers.title: Argon2 Memory-Hard Analysis
research_papers.problem: Password hashing schemes are often improperly configured, making them vulnerable to hardware-accelerated brute force.
research_papers.solution: Implemented Argon2 in Rust and analyzed its memory-hardness, timing profile, and GPU attack resistance.
findings: Detected optimal configurations for preventing GPU-parallelism
Observed 1.8× slowdown on insufficient RAM systems
Measured timing consistency across CPU generations
research_papers.impact: Helps engineers deploy safer authentication pipelines with correct Argon2 parameterization.

flagship_research.title: QuantumLock: Lattice-Based Encryption Engine
flagship_research.description: A post-quantum encryption engine built using lattice-based cryptographic primitives, designed to withstand quantum adversaries while maintaining practical performance on modern hardware.
findings: Key generation time reduced by 27% after SIMD-based vectorization
LWE decryption stabilized under multi-threaded workloads with negligible timing variance
Performance comparable to NIST PQC finalists under constrained CPU environments
flagship_research.impact: Contributes toward future-proof encryption systems resistant to quantum attacks, suitable for secure messaging, distributed systems, and embedded cryptography.

open_source_contributions.description: Security audit and test coverage improvements

experimental_projects.title: SHA-3 From Scratch
experimental_projects.description: Pure Rust implementation of Keccak-f permutation.

experimental_projects.title: LWE Key Exchange

experimental_projects.title: Homomorphic Encryption PoC
